result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Alexander Peckman Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges from 25% of prison funds, and during extended supervision on case 13CF5391, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide DNA sample.
Concurrent with: to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Alexander Peckman Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence.  Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges from 25% of prison funds, and during extended supervision on case 13CF5391, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide DNA Sample. Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Gary Alexander Peckman in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Gary Alexander Peckman in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Gary Alexander Peckman not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23. Received & Filed Restitution Worksheet. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Gary Alexander Peckman not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests an adjourned plea and sentencing date. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Gary Alexander Peckman not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests an adjourned date. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Gary Alexander Peckman not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Kohl's - 9035 South Howell Avenue
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gary Alexander Peckman in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Gary Alexander Peckman in custody.  
Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Gary Alexander Peckman Jr
Current: 3327 W Iona Terrace #1, Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States  (Effective: 04-15-2015)
Prior: 2193 South 95th Street, West Allis, WI 53227
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
